common.description: A Library Helm Chart for grouping common logic between bitnami charts. This chart is not deployable by itself.

exampleValue.description:
# bitnami/common
# It is required by CI/CD tools and processes.
#
#
exampleValue.title: exampleValue

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

common.title: common

diagnosticMode.description:
# Enable diagnostic mode in the statefulset
#
diagnosticMode.title: diagnosticMode

enabled.description: Conditional property used in parent chart
enabled.title: enabled

global.description:
#
# Please, note that this will override the parameters, including dependencies, configured to use the global value
#
global.title: global

debug.description:
# Set to true if you would like to see extra information on logs
#
debug.title: debug

pullPolicy.description:
# Specify a imagePullPolicy
# Defaults to 'Always' if image tag is 'latest', else set to 'IfNotPresent'
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/images/#pre-pulling-images
#
pullPolicy.title: pullPolicy

pullSecrets.description:
# Optionally specify an array of imagePullSecrets.
# Secrets must be manually created in the namespace.
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/
# Example:
# pullSecrets:
#   - myRegistryKeySecretName
#
pullSecrets.title: pullSecrets

ldap.description:
# LDAP configuration
#
# DEPRECATED ldap.url It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.uri' instead
#
#
#
#
# DEPRECATED ldap.baseDN It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.basedn' instead
# DEPRECATED ldap.bindDN It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.binddn' instead
# DEPRECATED ldap.bind_password It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.bindpw' instead
#
#
#
# DEPRECATED ldap.search_attr It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.searchAttribute' instead
# DEPRECATED ldap.search_filter It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.searchFilter' instead
#
#
#
# DEPRECATED ldap.tls as string is deprecatedï¼Œplease use 'ldap.tls.enabled' instead
#
#
ldap.title: ldap

containerSecurityContext.description:
# PostgreSQL Prometheus exporter containers' Security Context
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/#set-the-security-context-for-a-container
#
#
#
#
containerSecurityContext.title: containerSecurityContext

customMetrics.description:
#
# ref: https://github.com/wrouesnel/postgres_exporter#adding-new-metrics-via-a-config-file
# customMetrics:
#   pg_database:
#     query: "SELECT d.datname AS name, CASE WHEN pg_catalog.has_database_privilege(d.datname, 'CONNECT') THEN pg_catalog.pg_database_size(d.datname) ELSE 0 END AS size_bytes FROM pg_catalog.pg_database d where datname not in ('template0', 'template1', 'postgres')"
#     metrics:
#       - name:
#           usage: "LABEL"
#           description: "Name of the database"
#       - size_bytes:
#           usage: "GAUGE"
#           description: "Size of the database in bytes"
#
customMetrics.title: customMetrics

extraEnvVars.description:
#
# see: https://github.com/wrouesnel/postgres_exporter#environment-variables
# For example:
#  extraEnvVars:
#  - name: PG_EXPORTER_DISABLE_DEFAULT_METRICS
#    value: "true"
#
extraEnvVars.title: extraEnvVars

pullSecrets.description:
# Optionally specify an array of imagePullSecrets.
# Secrets must be manually created in the namespace.
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/
# Example:
# pullSecrets:
#   - myRegistryKeySecretName
#
pullSecrets.title: pullSecrets

livenessProbe.description:
# Configure extra options for PostgreSQL Prometheus exporter containers' liveness, readiness and startup probes
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/#configure-probes
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

prometheusRule.description:
# Custom PrometheusRule to be defined
# The value is evaluated as a template, so, for example, the value can depend on .Release or .Chart
# ref: https://github.com/coreos/prometheus-operator#customresourcedefinitions
#

rules.description:
#
# Make sure to constraint the rules to the current postgresql service.
# rules:
#   - alert: HugeReplicationLag
#     expr: pg_replication_lag{service="{{ printf "%s-metrics" (include "common.names.fullname" .) }}"} / 3600 > 1
#     for: 1m
#     labels:
#       severity: critical
#     annotations:
#       description: replication for {{ include "common.names.fullname" . }} PostgreSQL is lagging by {{ "{{ $value }}" }} hour(s).
#       summary: PostgreSQL replication is lagging by {{ "{{ $value }}" }} hour(s).
#
rules.title: rules

prometheusRule.title: prometheusRule

resources.description:
# PostgreSQL Prometheus exporter resource requests and limits
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/
#
#
#
resources.title: resources

customRules.description:
# Additional custom egress rules
# e.g:
# customRules:
#   - to:
#       - namespaceSelector:
#           matchLabels:
#             label: example
#
customRules.title: customRules

denyConnectionsToExternal.description: Deny connections to external. This is not compatible with an external database.
denyConnectionsToExternal.title: denyConnectionsToExternal

customRules.description:
# custom ingress rules
# e.g:
# customRules:
#   - from:
#       - namespaceSelector:
#           matchLabels:
#             label: example
#
customRules.title: customRules

customRules.description:
# custom ingress rules
# e.g:
# CustomRules:
#   - from:
#       - namespaceSelector:
#           matchLabels:
#             label: example
#
customRules.title: customRules

affinity.description:
#
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/#affinity-and-anti-affinity
# Note: primary.podAffinityPreset, primary.podAntiAffinityPreset, and primary.nodeAffinityPreset will be ignored when it's set
#
affinity.title: affinity

initContainers.description:
#
# Example
#
# initContainers:
#   - name: do-something
#     image: busybox
#     command: ['do', 'something']
#
initContainers.title: initContainers

scripts.description:
#
# Specify dictionary of scripts to be run at first boot
# e.g:
# scripts:
#   my_init_script.sh: |
#      #!/bin/sh
#      echo "Do something."
#
scripts.title: scripts

scriptsSecret.description:
#
# NOTE: This can work along `primary.initdb.scripts` or `primary.initdb.scriptsConfigMap`
#
scriptsSecret.title: scriptsSecret

livenessProbe.description:
# Configure extra options for PostgreSQL Primary containers' liveness, readiness and startup probes
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/#configure-probes
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

nodeAffinityPreset.description:
# PostgreSQL Primary node affinity preset
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/#node-affinity
#
nodeAffinityPreset.title: nodeAffinityPreset

mountPath.description:
#
# Note: useful when using custom PostgreSQL images
#
mountPath.title: mountPath

storageClass.description:
#
# If defined, storageClassName: <storageClass>
# If set to "-", storageClassName: "", which disables dynamic provisioning
# If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClassName spec is
#   set, choosing the default provisioner.  (gp2 on AWS, standard on
#   GKE, AWS & OpenStack)
#
storageClass.title: storageClass

subPath.description:
#
# Useful in dev environments and one PV for multiple services
#
subPath.title: subPath

pgHbaConfiguration.description:
#
# ref: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/auth-pg-hba-conf.html
# e.g:#
# pgHbaConfiguration: |-
#   local all all trust
#   host all all localhost trust
#   host mydatabase mysuser 192.168.0.0/24 md5
#
pgHbaConfiguration.title: pgHbaConfiguration

resources.description:
# PostgreSQL Primary resource requests and limits
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/
#
#
#
#
resources.title: resources

loadBalancerIP.description:
#
# Set the LoadBalancer service type to internal only
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#internal-load-balancer
#
loadBalancerIP.title: loadBalancerIP

nodePorts.description:
# Node ports to expose
# NOTE: choose port between <30000-32767>
#
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#type-nodeport
#
nodePorts.title: nodePorts

sessionAffinity.description:
#
# If "ClientIP", consecutive client requests will be directed to the same Pod
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies
#
sessionAffinity.title: sessionAffinity

sidecars.description:
#
# For example:
# sidecars:
#   - name: your-image-name
#     image: your-image
#     imagePullPolicy: Always
#     ports:
#       - name: portname
#         containerPort: 1234
#
sidecars.title: sidecars

standby.description:
# Configure current cluster's primary server to be the standby server in other cluster.
# This will allow cross cluster replication and provide cross cluster high availability.
# You will need to configure pgHbaConfiguration if you want to enable this feature with local cluster replication enabled.
#
#
#
#
standby.title: standby

rules.description:
#
# e.g:
# rules:
#   - apiGroups:
#       - ""
#     resources:
#       - pods
#     verbs:
#       - get
#       - list
#
rules.title: rules

affinity.description:
#
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/#affinity-and-anti-affinity
# Note: primary.podAffinityPreset, primary.podAntiAffinityPreset, and primary.nodeAffinityPreset will be ignored when it's set
#
affinity.title: affinity

initContainers.description:
#
# Example
#
# initContainers:
#   - name: do-something
#     image: busybox
#     command: ['do', 'something']
#
initContainers.title: initContainers

livenessProbe.description:
# Configure extra options for PostgreSQL read only containers' liveness, readiness and startup probes
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/#configure-probes
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

nodeAffinityPreset.description:
# PostgreSQL read only node affinity preset
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/#node-affinity
#
nodeAffinityPreset.title: nodeAffinityPreset

mountPath.description:
#
# Note: useful when using custom PostgreSQL images
#
mountPath.title: mountPath

storageClass.description:
#
# If defined, storageClassName: <storageClass>
# If set to "-", storageClassName: "", which disables dynamic provisioning
# If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClassName spec is
#   set, choosing the default provisioner.  (gp2 on AWS, standard on
#   GKE, AWS & OpenStack)
#
storageClass.title: storageClass

subPath.description:
#
# Useful in dev environments and one PV for multiple services
#
subPath.title: subPath

resources.description:
# PostgreSQL read only resource requests and limits
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/
#
#
#
#
resources.title: resources

loadBalancerIP.description:
#
# Set the LoadBalancer service type to internal only
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#internal-load-balancer
#
loadBalancerIP.title: loadBalancerIP

nodePorts.description:
# Node ports to expose
# NOTE: choose port between <30000-32767>
#
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#type-nodeport
#
nodePorts.title: nodePorts

sessionAffinity.description:
#
# If "ClientIP", consecutive client requests will be directed to the same Pod
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies
#
sessionAffinity.title: sessionAffinity

sidecars.description:
#
# For example:
# sidecars:
#   - name: your-image-name
#     image: your-image
#     imagePullPolicy: Always
#     ports:
#       - name: portname
#         containerPort: 1234
#
sidecars.title: sidecars

serviceAccount.description:
# Service account for PostgreSQL to use.
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/
#

automountServiceAccountToken.description:
#
# Can be set to false if pods using this serviceAccount do not need to use K8s API
#
automountServiceAccountToken.title: automountServiceAccountToken

name.description:
#
# If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the common.names.fullname template
#
name.title: name

serviceAccount.title: serviceAccount

shmVolume.description:
# Start PostgreSQL pod(s) without limitations on shm memory.
# By default docker and containerd (and possibly other container runtimes) limit `/dev/shm` to `64M`
# ref: https://github.com/docker-library/postgres/issues/416
# ref: https://github.com/containerd/containerd/issues/3654
#

sizeLimit.description:
#
# Note: the size of the tmpfs counts against container's memory limit
# e.g:
# sizeLimit: 1Gi
#
sizeLimit.title: sizeLimit

shmVolume.title: shmVolume

certCAFilename.description:
#
# If provided, PostgreSQL will authenticate TLS/SSL clients by requesting them a certificate
# ref: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/auth-methods.html
#
certCAFilename.title: certCAFilename

volumePermissions.description:
# Init containers parameters:
# volumePermissions: Change the owner and group of the persistent volume(s) mountpoint(s) to 'runAsUser:fsGroup' on each node
#

containerSecurityContext.description:
# Init container' Security Context
# Note: the chown of the data folder is done to containerSecurityContext.runAsUser
# and not the below volumePermissions.containerSecurityContext.runAsUser
#
#
containerSecurityContext.title: containerSecurityContext

pullSecrets.description:
# Optionally specify an array of imagePullSecrets.
# Secrets must be manually created in the namespace.
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/
# Example:
# pullSecrets:
#   - myRegistryKeySecretName
#
pullSecrets.title: pullSecrets

resources.description:
# Init container resource requests and limits
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/
#
#
#
resources.title: resources

volumePermissions.title: volumePermissions
